data.title: Football Club History Database
data.text:
WEST HAM UNITED

1900 Thames Ironworks changed name to West Ham United 1901-02 Also joined Western League and London League London League Champions 1902-03 London League runner-up 1904 Left London League 1906-07 Western League Division 1B Champions. Overall Champions after beating Division 1A Champions Fulham 1-0 at Chelsea (15.4.1907) 1919-20 Elected to Football League Division Two 1922-23 Football League Division Two runner-up Promoted to Division One (on goal average) F.A. Cup runner-up 1932 Relegated to Division Two 1932-33 F.A. Cup semi-finalists 1934-35 Missed promotion to Division One by goal average 1939-40 Football League programme abandoned due to outbreak of war 1957-58 Football League Division Two Champions Promoted to Division One 1963-64 Football League Cup semi-finalists F.A. Cup Winners 1964-65 European Cup Winners Cup Winners 1965-66 European Cup Winners Cup Semi-Finalists Football League Cup runner-up 1966-67 Football League Cup semi-finalists 1971-72 Football League Cup semi-finalists 1974-75 F.A. Cup Winners (2nd time) 1975-76 European Cup Winners Cup Runner-up 1978 Relegated to Division Two 1979-80 F.A. Cup Winners (3rd time) 1980-81 Football League Division Two Champions Promoted to Division One European Cup Winners Cup Quarter Finalists Football League Cup runner-up 1987 Escaped relegation on goal difference 1988-89 Football League Cup semi-finalists Relegated to Division Two 1989-90 Football League Cup semi-finalists 1990-91 Football League Division Two runner-up Promoted to Division One F.A. Cup semi-finalists 1992 Relegated to Division Two, which was then re-designated Division One on formation of F.A. Premier League 1992-93 Football League Division One runner-up, and automatically promoted to F.A. Premier League, on goals scored 2003 Relegated to Football League Division One 2003-04 Not promoted after play-offs (SF Ipswich Town 1 West Ham United 0, West Ham United 2 Ipswich Town 0 - Agg 2-1, F Crystal Palace 1 West Ham United 0 @ Millennium Stadium, Cardiff) 2004-05 Division One renamed "Football League Championship" Promoted to Premier League after play-offs (SF West Ham United 2 Ipswich Town 2, Ipswich Town 0 West Ham United 2 - Agg 4-2, F West Ham United 1 Preston North End 0 @ Millennium Stadium, Cardiff) 2005-06 F.A. Cup runner-up 2010-11 Football League Cup semi-finalists 2011 Relegated to Football League Championship 2011-12 Promoted to Premier League after play-offs (SF Cardiff City 0 West Ham United 2, West Ham United 3 Cardif City 0 - Agg 0-5, F West Ham United 2-1 Birmingham City @ Wembley Stadium) 2013-14 Football League Cup semi-finalists SEASON LEAGUE P W D L F A P POS 1900-01 SOUTH-1 28 14 5 9 40
